paragraphs.text:
%md

# Introduction to Machine Learning using Linear Regression

![spark-ml-lib](https://2xbbhjxc6wk3v21p62t8n4d4-wpengine.netdna-ssl.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/spark-mllib-logo.png)

msg.data: Introduction to Machine Learning using Linear Regression

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Introduction

In this lab we’ll cover basics of building a Linear Regression model using Apache Spark ML Pipeline API.

- Starting from a simple 2 dim array
- Using Pipeline API to create vectorised version of features and build the model
- Using Pipeline API to calculate predictions
- Exchanging data between Scala and Python pandas via TempView (new API in 2.x)
- Simplified plotting by using pandas plot function (pandas similar as Spark DataFrame)
- Saving and loading back the model

msg.data:
Introduction

In this lab we’ll cover basics of building a Linear Regression model using Apache Spark ML Pipeline API.

  • Starting from a simple 2 dim array
  • Using Pipeline API to create vectorised version of features and build the model
  • Using Pipeline API to calculate predictions
  • Exchanging data between Scala and Python pandas via TempView (new API in 2.x)
  • Simplified plotting by using pandas plot function (pandas similar as Spark DataFrame)
  • Saving and loading back the model

paragraphs.text:
%md ## What is a model? A machine learning model consists of data provided to a machine learning algorithm which includes the correct answer (Target attribute) to the problem that it is trying to solve.
The machine learning algorithm is tasked with finding patterns in the data and producing a model which reflect the patterns in the data.
For a more specific explanation of the model used here visit the [**Hortonworks tutorial**](https://hortonworks.com/tutorial/intro-to-machine-learning-with-apache-spark-and-apache-zeppelin/#what-is-a-model).

msg.data:
What is a model?

A machine learning model consists of data provided to a machine learning algorithm which includes the correct answer (Target attribute) to the problem that it is trying to solve.
The machine learning algorithm is tasked with finding patterns in the data and producing a model which reflect the patterns in the data.
For a more specific explanation of the model used here visit the Hortonworks tutorial.

paragraphs.title: Create a small data set that we will use for our Linear Regression model

msg.data:
import org.apache.spark.ml.linalg.Vectors
data: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [y: double, x: double]

paragraphs.title: Run Linear Regression
paragraphs.text:
%spark.spark

import org.apache.spark.ml.Pipeline
import org.apache.spark.ml.feature.VectorAssembler
import org.apache.spark.ml.regression.{LinearRegression, LinearRegressionModel}

// Set Features
val features = (new VectorAssembler()
    .setInputCols(Array("x"))
    .setOutputCol("features"))

val linreg = new LinearRegression().setLabelCol("y")
  
val pipeline = new Pipeline().setStages(Array(features, linreg))
val model = pipeline.fit(data)

msg.data:
import org.apache.spark.ml.Pipeline
import org.apache.spark.ml.feature.VectorAssembler
import org.apache.spark.ml.regression.{LinearRegression, LinearRegressionModel}
features: org.apache.spark.ml.feature.VectorAssembler = vecAssembler_8e5a8a326ed5
linreg: org.apache.spark.ml.regression.LinearRegression = linReg_5845f09456ec
pipeline: org.apache.spark.ml.Pipeline = pipeline_143fcc5c7c66
model: org.apache.spark.ml.PipelineModel = pipeline_143fcc5c7c66

paragraphs.title: Summarize model training
paragraphs.text:
%spark.spark

val linRegModel = model.stages(1).asInstanceOf[LinearRegressionModel]

println(s"RMSE:  ${linRegModel.summary.rootMeanSquaredError}")
println(s"r2:    ${linRegModel.summary.r2}")
println(s"Model: Y = ${linRegModel.coefficients(0)} * X + ${linRegModel.intercept}")

linRegModel.summary.residuals.show()

paragraphs.title: Use the same data to predict the model
Load back the model

msg.data:
import org.apache.spark.ml.regression.{LinearRegression, LinearRegressionModel}
sameModel: org.apache.spark.ml.regression.LinearRegression = linReg_5845f09456ec
sameLinRegModel: org.apache.spark.ml.regression.LinearRegressionModel = linReg_5845f09456ec
Coefficient: [2.8057645950707633] Intercept: 3.045896709023058

paragraphs.text:
%md

#### Visualise the model and training data

**_Note_**: The following paragraphs require the Python [**Pandas**](https://pandas.pydata.org/) library which is not installed by default. In order to run these paragraphs check back in to the Intro to [Machine Learning with Apache Spark and Apache Zeppelin appendix A](https://hortonworks.com/tutorial/intro-to-machine-learning-with-apache-spark-and-apache-zeppelin/#appendix-a-installing-anaconda-on-the-hortonworks-data-platform-sandbox) and install Pandas using Anaconda. By installing Anaconda you will have access to myriad of Machine Learning and Data Science packages which will help you get started with your journey as a data scientist using HDP.

msg.data:
Visualise the model and training data

Note: The following paragraphs require the Python Pandas library which is not installed by default. In order to run these paragraphs check back in to the Intro to Machine Learning with Apache Spark and Apache Zeppelin appendix A and install Pandas using Anaconda. By installing Anaconda you will have access to myriad of Machine Learning and Data Science packages which will help you get started with your journey as a data scientist using HDP.

paragraphs.title: Plot the result (requires Pandas)
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark import StringIO def show(p): img = StringIO.StringIO() p.get_figure().savefig(img, format='svg') img.seek(0) print "%html
" + img.buf + "
" plot = linreg.plot.scatter(x='x', y='y') plot.plot(linreg["x"], linreg["prediction"]) # show(plot)

paragraphs.title: More ML Algorithms
paragraphs.text:
%md

In this lab we have looked at Linear Regression, but there are other popular algorithms. In the following labs we'll begin exploring:

- [Decision trees](https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/ml-classification-regression.html#decision-trees)
- [Random forest](https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/ml-classification-regression.html#random-forests)
- [K-Means Clustering](https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/ml-clustering.html#k-means)

msg.data:
In this lab we have looked at Linear Regression, but there are other popular algorithms. In the following labs we’ll begin exploring:

  • Decision trees
  • Random forest
  • K-Means Clustering

paragraphs.title: Additional Resources
paragraphs.text:
%md

We hope you've enjoyed this introductory lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

1. [Hortonworks Apache Spark Tutorials](https://hortonworks.com/tutorials/?filters=apache-spark#tuts-developers) 
2. [Hortonworks Community Connection (HCC)](https://community.hortonworks.com/spaces/85/data-science.html?type=question) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
3. [Hortonworks Apache Spark Docs](http://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP2/HDP-2.6.5/bk_spark-component-guide/content/ch_developing-spark-apps.html) - official Spark documentation.
4. [Hortonworks Apache Zeppelin Docs](http://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP2/HDP-2.6.5/bk_zeppelin-component-guide/content/ch_using_zeppelin.html) - official Zeppelin documentation.
